subNodes.conversationText: root

The journey seems to last an age. All around the city are the sounds of struggle and destruction. You lose count of the times that you are forced to hide down alleys or behind rubbish to avoid marauding gangs of cultists or opportunist gangs of looters. You see little sign of the city guard, except for the occasional corpse.

Mara, however, proves a reliable guide. The route she takes you is relatively quiet and steers well clear of the main flashpoints at the castle and the temple. You are somewhere in a maze of streets to the west of the city when she stops at an unremarkable door and knocks four times, with particular emphasis on the first and fourth strike. The door opens, and you slip into a well lit room.
Continue

"Mara! It is good to see you." A tall woman with a striking posture and clear blue eyes gives your group a sad smile. "We have lost so many today, I worried that I would also be counting you amonst my sorrows."
Continue

"I slipped their net, Aren. I had help from these two - their names are <FullName> and Kano, from the city watch I believe. I would be dead if it wasn't for them. And you know Serl Dorian, of course."
Continue
"I thank you for thinking of me at this time, Aren. I'm afraid my own guard was unprepared to deal with such an onslaught. It appears that I owe you my life."
Continue

"You are all very welcome. I'm sorry that the Guild's hospitality is a bit underwhelming today, but you may rest in this building for as long as you like."

Her piercing eyes fall on you. "But you are wrong about this one, Mara. He is no city guard. He is an agent of the Lord Chancellor, here on a mission to extract a high value prisoner."
"Is that a problem?"
"Not at all. The purpose of the Guild is to support political and social stability in order to provide increased trade and wealth. We are great allies of the Lord Chancellor in that regard."
"Political and social stability? You don't seem to be doing a good job."

She lets out a bitter laugh. "No, I don't suppose we are. The city has completely fallen to the cultists. The Seneschal is dead and the city guard are scattered. In normal times, Lord Dorian would be in line to be the new Seneschal, but the lead cultist will no doubt take this role for himself. I'm afraid this is why they came after you this morning, Dorian."

Dorian pales.
Continue

"In fairness to the Guildmistress, <FullName>, these have beeen difficult days. The war with the Skaal cut off many of the sea routes required for trade, and the city has suffered greatly as a result. The people starve in great numbers. Over recent years, crime has rocketed. These... cultist thugs are the result of the poverty."
"You didn't seem to be doing too badly in your massive house, Dorian."

"Yes, well, these things are relative, my dear <boy/girl>. Compared to the wealthy lords on your side of the sea, such as Cromnor himself, I think I would appear poor indeed. We asked for help many times from the King, but his attention was always elsewhere."

"Anyway, I promised you answers when we got to safety, and here we are. I seem to owe you an explanation."
Continue

"I don't know where your prisoner is. I had secured him in my cellar rather than the garrison simply because it made sense for as few people as posssible to know about him. How the cult got to hear of him, why they chose to break him about, where he is now... I don't know the answer to any of those questions."
Continue

"I may be able to cast some light on this. Dorian, I did not entirely trust your cellar prison, and I wanted a contingency in case he managed to break lose. The last thing this city needed was the wrath of the Lord Chancellor. I had his collar fitted with a hex that would allow me to track his movements."

"He left the city this morning, travelling south. He must have removed the collar shortly afterwards, as the hex has since gone dead."
Continue
"Travelling south? What, to Gildoen? Its just a fishing village."
Continue

Aren Kevrel shrugs. "Who knows where he was travelling to. He may have holed up in the forests or the hills. Or perhaps the cultists have a base somewhere in one of those remote places and he is hiding with them."

"One thing is certain: he is a devious little rat and will not be easy to find."
Continue
"You probably have questions."
"Who are these cultists?"

"They appeared a couple of years back, lurking on the outskirts of the Mirthal forest and ranting their crazy beliefs, such as their wish to bring back live sacrifices to the old gods. It was not a popular message, of course, and it gained little traction in common thought. We thought we could ignore them."
Continue

"That was a mistake. They took a new leader, a man called Augin,  a man of immense charisma and a way with the common folk. I'm afraid we underestimated him. When the trade routes collapsed and the city was plunged into poverty, more and more turned to the cult."

She sighs. "We should have done more to stop him whilst we had the chance."
Continue

"We tried, Guildmistress. We tried to infiltrate them many times, but they always knew. They captured and burned many of my comrades as a warning."

Kano grimaces and turns away.
Continue

"And here we are. They seem to have managed to organise a massive uprising and caused untold damage to the city."

She pauses.

"In effect, they seem to be in charge now. We must be careful."
Continue
"You probably have questions."
"Why couldn't the city guards stop the cultists when they attacked?"
"We tried, <FullName>. But the guard was outnumbered. We haven't been properly funded since the sea trade collapsed."
Continue

"Also, the cult managed to get a large number of well armed fighters through the City Gate unchallenged, and know exactly where and when to strike. They clearly had help from inside the guard... although I don't know who would be foolish enough to get into bed with those savages."
Continue
"You probably have questions."
"Is the Baron in league with the cultists?"
"Well, they rescued him from Lord Dorian's cellar. It certainly looks that way, don't you think?"
Continue
"I agree with Mara. The Baron is a dangerous, angry man, and if he is in league with the cultists then we need to be careful."
Continue
"You probably have questions."
"Tell me about the areas around the city."

"To the south is the Mirthal, a forest filled with bandits and worse. Beyond that is the fishing town of Gildoen, a sleepy place of llittle incident. If you head east across the Banberg Bridge you will come to Castle Kellwall, the ancient residence of the Kellwyn family. North of the castle are mountains, and south is the Raventhal, a forest I strongly advise you avoid. It has a sinister reputation, one which the Baron would be well aware of. He will not have fled there."
Continue
"You probably have questions."
"Do you know what the Baron was doing in Blackwinter?"

"He was caught on the outskirts of the Mirthal Forest. Whilst he was in captivity he barely spoke a word. He refused to explain what he was doing here."

Dorian pauses.

"And, to be honest, I did not press the point. It seems that he is very important to the King, and I had no wish to hear something secret that... well, that I might personally come to regret."
Continue
"I don't know, either, <FullName>. He would appear to be in league with the cult, but beyond that he aims are unclear."
Continue
"You probably have questions."
"I've heard enough. Can you get me out of the city to continue my hunt?"
"Yes, of course."
Continue
"Guildmistress, I would like to accompany <FullName>. It is in our interests to track down this Baron and gain the goodwill of the Lord Chancellor."
Continue
"Very well. If <FullName> wishes it, of course."
"Mara, I would welcome your help."
"If the city has fallen to the cultists, there is no place for me here either. I would like to accompany you as well."
"I was hoping you would ask. You are very welcome, Kano."

"So then, it is decided. The three of you will leave the city tonight on your hunt."

"If you manage to find the Baron, you will still need a ship to take him back to the Lord Chancellor. Mara, if you can find me, I will make the arrangements for you."
Continue

"Ahhh.... there is one more thing, actually. I seem to be homeless, penniless, and a target for excecution. And if they catch me, it won't be a quick death." Dorian shudders. "I'm sure the Guildmistress will keep me safe, but I think I'd feel a little more secure if I was somewhere other than Blackwinter for a while. Perhaps I could tag along with you, dear <boy/girl>? My magic is a little rusty from neglect, but I'm sure it will come back to me quickly enough."
Continue
"Dorian, are you sure about this? Their road will not be an easy one."
"Dorian, you are very welcome to travel with me until things quieten down here. Your magic will be useful."

"Very well. I will ensure that you get safe passage out of the city tonight. I cannot ensure hat getting back into the city will be easy though. Good luck in your quest, and I hope that we meet again."

Aren Kevrel shakes each of your hands in turn and then leaves you.
Continue
"Dorian, your place is in the city. I don't want you to join me."
"Kano, your place is here in the city, not on the road with me."
"No thank you. Mara, you would do more good here in the city than travelling the roads with me."
